Rule Rest APIÂ¶

Overview

Resource Operation Description
AllRule POST /rule/ create new rule
  GET /rule/ get all rules for account
MoveRule POST /rule/(rule_id)/mode move rule
ReduceRule POST /rule/(rule_id)/reduce reduce rule
ReplicaLocks GET /rule/(rule_id)/locks get locks by rule id
Rule PUT /rule/(rule_id) update rule
  GET /rule/(rule_id) get rule info
  DELETE /rule/(rule_id) delete rule
RuleAnalysis GET /rule/(rule_id)/analysis analyse rule,
RuleHistory GET /rule/(rule_id)/history get rule history by id
RuleHistoryFull GET /rule/(scope)/(name)/history get rule history for DID

Details

POST /rule/Â¶

Create a new replication rule.

Request JSON Object:
 
  • dids (list) â List of data identifiers.
  • account (string) â Account issuing the rule.
  • copies (int) â The number of replicas.
  • rse_expression (string) â RSE expression which gets resolved into a list of RSEs.
  • grouping (string) â ALL - All files will be replicated to the same RSE. DATASET - All files in the same dataset will be replicated to the same RSE. NONE - Files will be completely spread over all allowed RSEs without any grouping considerations at all
  • weight (int) â Weighting scheme to be used.
  • lifetime (int) â The lifetime of the replication rule in seconds.
  • locked (string) â If the is locked.
  • subscription_id (string) â The subscription_id, if the rule is created by a subscription.
  • source_replica_expression (string) â Only use replicas as source from these RSEs.
  • activity (string) â Activity to be passed to the conveyor.
  • notify (string) â Notification setting of the rule (âYâ, âNâ, âCâ; None = âNâ).
  • purge_replicas (bool) â Purge setting if a replica should be directly deleted after the rule is deleted.
  • ignore_availability (bool) â Option to ignore the availability of RSEs.
  • comments (string) â Comment about the rule.
  • ask_approval (bool) â Ask for approval for this rule.
  • asynchronous (bool) â Create replication rule asynchronously by the judge-injector.
  • priority (int) â Priority of the rule and the transfers which should be submitted.
  • split_container (bool) â Should a container rule be split into individual dataset rules.
  • meta (string) â Dictionary with metadata from the WFMS.
Status Codes:
  • 201 Created â rule created
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token
  • 404 Not Found â DID not found
  • 409 Conflict â Invalid Replication Rule
  • 409 Conflict â Duplicate Replication Rule
  • 409 Conflict â Insufficient Target RSEs
  • 409 Conflict â Insufficient Account Limit
  • 409 Conflict â Invalid RSE Expression
  • 409 Conflict â Replication Rule Creation Temporary Failed
  • 409 Conflict â Invalid Rule Weight
  • 409 Conflict â Staging Area Rule Requires Lifetime
  • 409 Conflict â Scratch Disk Lifetime Conflict
  • 409 Conflict â Manual Rule Approval Blocked
  • 409 Conflict â Invalid Object
Returns:

List of ids for created rules
GET /rule/Â¶

Return all rules of a given account.

Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token
  • 404 Not Found â no rule found for id
Query Parameters:
 
  • scope â The scope name.
GET /rule/(rule_id)/analysisÂ¶

get analysis for given rule.

Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Database Exception
Returns:

JSON dict containing informations about the requested user.
GET /rule/(rule_id)/historyÂ¶

get history for a given rule_id.

Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Database Exception
Returns:

JSON dict containing informations about the requested user.
POST /rule/(rule_id)/reduceÂ¶

Reduce a replication rule.

Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found.
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token.
  • 404 Not Found â no rule found for id.
  • 409 Conflict â Rule replace failed.
Returns:

List of rule ids
GET /rule/(rule_id)/locksÂ¶

get locks for a given rule_id.

Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Database Exception
Returns:

JSON dict containing informations about the requested user.
POST /rule/(rule_id)/modeÂ¶

Move a replication rule.

Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token
  • 404 Not Found â no rule found for id
  • 409 Conflict â Rule replace failed.
Returns:

List of rule ids.
GET /rule/(scope)/(name)/historyÂ¶

get history for a given DID.

Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type â application/x-json-stream
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found
  • 500 Internal Server Error â Database Exception
Returns:

JSON dict containing informations about the requested user.
PUT /rule/(rule_id)Â¶

Update the replication rules locked flag .

Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token
  • 404 Not Found â no rule found for id
GET /rule/(rule_id)Â¶

get rule information for given rule id.

Returns:

JSON dict containing informations about the requested user.
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â Rule found
  • 410 Gone â Invalid Auth Token
  • 404 Not Found â no rule found for id
DELETE /rule/(rule_id)Â¶

Delete a new replication rule.

Status Codes:
  • 200 OK â DIDs found
  • 401 Unauthorized â Invalid Auth Token
  • 404 Not Found â no rule found for id
